meanings.definition: A sail used to catch the wind and propel a boat.
meanings.sent1: The windsail on the ship billowed in the breeze, pushing us forward.
meanings.sent2: The sailors adjusted the windsail to harness the power of the wind.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the windsail, enjoying the free ride.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter carried through the windsail, filling the air with joy.
meanings.sent5: The colorful windsail danced gracefully as the boat glided across the water.

meanings.definition: A device used to ventilate or cool a building by capturing wind.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a windsail on the roof to bring in fresh air.
meanings.sent2: The windsail in the attic helped circulate cool air during summer.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot next to the windsail, enjoying the cool breeze.
meanings.sent4: The windsail whispered secrets as the wind passed through its openings.
meanings.sent5: The windsail hummed softly, bringing relief from the heat inside the building.
